result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermayne L Fuller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full from bond on file.
Not to possess any firearms or weapons.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to associate with any known illegal drug users or dealers.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Credit for 11 days if revoked.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Granted credit for 201 days sentence credit.  All previously court ordered financial obligations were paid in full.
Concurrent with: Prison sentence now serving

ADDRESS INFO for Jermayne L Fuller
Current: P.O. Box 700, Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963-0700 United States  (Effective: 12-22-2016)
Prior: 5518 North 41st St., Milwaukee, WI 53209 United States
2 certified copies of JOCR sent to Dodge Correctional

Defendant appears in custody in person with counsel Christopher Ertl.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  DA Fox notes 1 error in packet - DOC recomendation exceeds max sentence available - must be a max of 18 months initial confinement and max extended supervision of 2 years.  Court makes note that it is incorrect and agrees with the correct maximum stated by DA Fox.  DA Fox states there is 201 days sentence credit.  Attorney Ertl agrees with DA Fox on the error and the sentence credit.  No corrections noted by defense.  DA Fox recommends a bifurcated sentence of 18 months initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision.  DA Fox marks Exhibit 1 - 2 pages of photos.  He states there are no victim issues in this case.  Attorney Ertl makes his sentencing argument to the Court.  His recommendation for sentencing is a 9 month jail sentence concurrent to prison sentence he is now serving.  Defendant excercieses his right to allocution.  

Court orders a sentence of 1 year jail with credit for 201 days served, to be served concurrent to prison sentence now serving.

No weapons possession.  Defense agrees with State's recommendation.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Gardner.  State's motion to revoke bond.  State is moving to dismiss the motion to revoke.  Motion dismissed by court.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Attorney Gardner appeared by telephone.  State has filed a motion to revoke bond.  Attorney Gardner advised that the defendant would be available to hear the motion on Monday 1/25 at 1:00 pm.
to revoke bond and issue arrest warrant.
from Milwaukee Cty DA for CC complaint/bond (mailed out today)

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Gardner.   Plead to count 1.  DRI Count 2.   Court advised the defendant of the charge and possible penalties of the charge he is pleading to.  Defendant plead no contest to count 1.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Felony warnings given.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of count 1.  PSI ordered due 2/12.  Sentencing set for 2/29/16 at 1:30 pm
Schedule 1/2 hour preliminary hearing, per Judge and set on the 2016 JT calendar.
